intro: Microstylis bengkulensis, commonly known as the Bengkulu microstylis, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Indonesia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
